title: John Fogerty - Blue Ridge Rangers & Rides Again / 2CD
description:
As the prime mover in Creedence Clearwater Revival, John Fogerty created possibly some of the best Rock music of the late 1960s / early 1970s.
With wonderfully chosen songs, his solo debut Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Blue Ridge RangersÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ (1973) has held up well over the last four decades - a wonderfully engaging record; upbeat, unpretentious, and loaded with good songs.
On its sequel Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Blue Ridge Rangers Rides AgainÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ (2009) he revives that concept. But Ã¢â‚¬Å“Rides AgainÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ is a lot looser in its attack, something reflected in how it splits the difference between country and rockabilly classics and reflective numbers from '70s songwriters. 


John Fogerty

CD 1: The Blue Ridge Rangers, 1973

CD 2: The Blue Ridge Rangers Rides Again, 2009


 2 CDs / 1991, 2009 / 320Kbps

Note: The apparent grammatical error in the title of the album Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Blue Ridge Rangers Rides AgainÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ (the verb should be conjugated 'ride,' not 'rides') is a play on the fact that the original Ã¢â‚¬Å“Blue Ridge RangersÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ album consisted entirely of Fogerty singing all the vocals and playing all the instruments by himself
